Inter make enquiry for Fabian Ruiz from Real Betis, while next days could be decisive for Pastore

After Joao Mario's departure to West Ham, Inter are on the lookout for a midfielder and the new name is Real Betis Fabian Ruiz. Nerazzurri made an enquiry with Betis for the Spaniard who has a €15 million release clause in his contract. The player, anyway, is reluctant to leave his club in January, but he may be willing to leave at the end of the season. In the meanwhile, Betis have show interest in Japanese full-back Yuto Nagatomo.

Today Inter made no further contact with Javier Pastore's entourage, but tomorrow his agent will meet PSG to discuss the possibility to open negotiations with the Italian club.

Javier Pastore is prepared to leave Paris Saint-Germain for regular playing time at Inter. “I’d like to go there, but I don’t know what’ll happen.”

The Argentina international is increasingly frustrated in Ligue 1 and is eager for a transfer to San Siro.

“I don’t know what I’ll do yet, because the situation is very difficult,” Pastore told reporters after today’s game.

“I am very happy in Paris, but I haven’t made any decisions yet. All I want is to play more regularly so I can go to the World Cup. Not being in the tournament because I stayed here and didn’t play would be very painful for my career.

“I need to make a decision along with the club. I must do more to get into the World Cup squad, as I wasn’t called up by Argentina last time because I wasn’t playing. I have to play regularly to have a better chance.”

Pastore was asked specifically about Inter and did not disguise the negotiations.

“There is a lot of talk about Inter and if I were to leave, I’d like to go there, especially as I know Serie A and my wife is Italian,” said the former Palermo striker.

“Inter could be a solution, but I don’t know what will happen. It’s not an easy decision for me or the club. We’ll see over the next few days and try to reach an agreement.”

Inter are only able to sign Pastore on loan with option to buy at the end of the season, but Paris Saint-Germain want guarantees.

Brozovic Accepts Sevilla’s Offer As Inter Turn Attention To Atletico Madrid’s Gaitan

Italian media outlet Sky Sport Italia report that Marcelo Brozovic has accepted the offer from La Liga side Sevilla led by former AC Milan coach Vincenzo Montella.

According to Sky Sport transfer market expert Gianluca Di Marzio reports that the Spanish club have made an offer of €1 million to loan Brozovic until the end of the season. Should the La Liga outfit wish to make the transfer permanent they would have to pay an additional €28 million meaning it is only an option and not a forced option.

Now Brozovic has given the move the green light, the ball is back in Inter’s court who must make a decision whether or not to let the Croatian international midfielder to leave or not. Luciano Spalletti, however, has blocked the transfer until Inter find a substitute for Brozovic

Sky Sport Italia report further more that Inter have still not given up on PSG’s Javier Pastore but this does not prevent the Nerazzurri to try to land Atletico Madrid’s Argentinian winger Nicolas Gaitan. The former Benfica player has long been sought after by Roberto Mancini’s Zenit who are still pursuing him, but his former paymasters, who have been rumored to be interested in Gaitan, have not given up quite yet.

Piero Ausilio: “Inter Have Never Negotiated With PSG For Pastore”


Inter’s Sporting Director Piero Ausilio stopped by the gathering media outside of Inter’s headquarters in central Milano to answer questions on the just concluded transfer window.
Ausilio began by talking about the situation concerning Pastore and PSG saying: “There were never any negotiations ongoing for Pastore. We have always been honest and sincere that the basis needed to sign him as not there. Once we understood that we could not sign him on loan with an option to buy we decided to pull back.
“How well we have done on the transfer window can be seen on the pitch. Inter have to be competitive for the Champions League. We have done what we wanted to do. We signed a central defender and we signed a player with a big future ahead of him like Rafinha as well as having shrunk the squad” Ausilio continued.
The Nerazzurri director was asked about the rumors concerning Pinamonti and Brozovic to which he replid: “We never negotiated with anyone for his transfer. He is a very talented player who Spalletti has a lot of confidence in. We negotiated with Sassuolo about Pinamonti but in the end the player decided to stay.”
In conclusion Ausilio spoke about Mauro Icardi: “I am not worried about his injury. I wont comment on his social media posts, I comment on what happens on the pitch. I don’t discuss his travels or posts on social media, there are other things that are important. Now is not the right time to think about extending his contract.”

The January window may have just closed, but Inter is already working to acquire a player for the future. The nerazzurri are trying to close the deal for Lautaro Martinez, the promising striker born in ‘97 currently playing for Racing Avallenada. Martinez is considered to be one of the best talents in South America, as a matter of fact Sampaoli is considering the possibility of taking him to the World Cup in Russia- Inter have been pursuing the central striker for months despite the fact that Atletico Madrid have been in pole position to acquire him for quite some time.

Atletico Madrid had agreed to terms with Martinez and even gave him a medical, but they failed to reach an agreement with Racing, leaving the door open for Inter to join the race. The nerazzurri’s vice president Javier Zanetti has been working on the deal for days, and after meeting with Martinez’ agents in Italy, Inter feels confident they have the player’s approval for the transfer so much so that sporting director Piero Ausilio left for Argentina to close the deal for €15 million plus bonuses, a figure very close to the amount of the striker’s exit clause.

While Atletico Madrid haven’t given up on signing Martinez, Inter can count on their historic affinity with Argentinian players, on top of Javier Zanetti’s presence, there’s the fact that their former striker Diego Milito is Racing Avellaneda’s current sporting director and will even have Rodrigo Palacio, who is from Martinez home town of Bahia Blanca put in a good word. Inter are working on closing the deal for one of Argentina’s top prospects.

Inter is looking to the future and have made significant progress in their pursuit of one of the emerging talents in South America. The nerazzurri are expected to acquire Lautaro Martinez next June, sporting director Piero Ausilio’s trip to South America was successful since the striker born in ’97 has decided to join Spalletti’s squad. Martinez is expected to sign a contract through 2023 with his current club Racing Avellaneda receiving 20.2 million euro including taxes, there’s a verbal agreement on the figure which exceeds the player’s release clause. The official announcement is expected to come later on after the contracts and documents have been deposited. In the meantime, Inter is ready to welcome Martinez, the work from director Ausilio and vice president Zanetti has paid off.

Welcome Lautaro

Racing主席、教練及經理人等均證實lautaro會加盟國米，交易金額為20m歐元（16m+tax）再加2m獎金及10%sell-on fee，國米成功擊敗皇馬、馬體會、曼聯及華西等球會，原因係球員極渴望加盟國米。球員有呢個意願係因為米列圖介入，大米曾經向球員介紹國米，而球員視大米為偶像同埋Racing嘅Icon，所以就想跟隨大米嘅步伐，同時大米係Racing嘅Sporting secretary，落力促成咗呢單交易。

球員即將會進行體測，六月加盟國米，合約中違約金為110m至120m，價值等同於伊卡迪。而Lautaro有機會入選阿根廷國家隊，進行對意大利嘅友誼賽。

意大利媒體稱，國際米蘭對球隊中堅史基尼亞的心理價位在8000萬歐元左右。

史基尼亞本賽季憑藉出色的表現吸引了歐洲眾多豪門的關注，巴塞隆拿就一直和這名斯洛伐克中堅聯繫在一起。儘管才加盟國際米蘭一個賽季，但媒體認為球隊已經準備好高價賣掉史基尼亞。

據《都靈體育報》報導的消息，如果有球隊為史基尼亞報價8000萬歐元，那麼國際米蘭就可能會放人。

如果史基尼亞離開國米，那麼球隊就將追逐拉素後衛迪華積，後者和球隊的合同本賽季結束後到期。

Inter defender Milan Skriniar reveals he received a “breath-taking offer in January,” but wouldn’t leave “to sit on the bench.”

The former Sampdoria man has seen his price-tag more than double in the six months since coming to San Siro.

He spoke to Slovakian paper Sport and was asked about a €65m offer from one of Europe’s top clubs in January.

“I do recognise it was a breath-taking offer. To be honest, I didn’t try to do anything about it, as I left it all in the hands of my agent,” said Skriniar.

“I was told that Inter would not let me go, but if needed, I would leave. Karol told me I would stay and I replied: ‘Super, I can’t wait to concentrate on Inter.’

“I don’t know what club would tempt me away… The most attractive to me are Real Madrid and Barcelona, but the Manchester sides are also top clubs.

“It would also depend on the agreements or what role I’d be guaranteed. If I were to just sit on the bench or play in the Cup competitions, I wouldn’t go anywhere.

“I think if I do go somewhere, it’ll be to a club where I have a realistic chance of playing.”

Lazio. Tare’:”De Vrij’s extension? We’re withdrawing our proposal”

Despite a lengthy negiation, Stefan de Vrij won’t extend his contract with Lazio after all. Today the biancocelesti’s sporting director Igli Tare discussed the Dutch center back’s future in an interview with Premium Sport:”Lazio are withdrawing the proposal made to the player for reasons we’ll state at a later date. It’s decision made after many months. There’s a limit to everything. He’s a professional who gave a lot, but we’ll say good bye at the end of the season” With an expiring contract, De Vrij will ponder offers from other clubs including Inter and Barcelona

Dutch coach Frank De Boer looked back to his unsuccesful 84 days at Inter in an interview with Ziggo sport: "There were 7-8 players "in charge" in the locker room and they kept out the rest of the group. I didn't expect to find such a situation. I had a rough time trying to make the players understand my ideas, it wasn't easy. The players did whatever they wanted, I tried to bring a different style but they didn't follow me, they wouldn't listen to me. The youngsters in Ajax academy listened and worked more than the players at Inter".

國米外租大將：我想留在西甲 國米太亂不想回

國米租借給華倫西亞的中場球員干杜比亞在接受採訪時表示，他希望能永久轉會華倫西亞，不想再回國米了。

在接受西班牙媒體採訪時，干杜比亞說：「我認為國米真正的問題是缺乏穩定，那裡只有混亂，兩年的時間里我先後與四五名教練共事，球隊不斷在變化。」

「在這種情況下球員很難進步，特別是年輕球員。如果不斷換教練，很難讓球會變的更好。」

實際上，在馬塞利諾來到華倫西亞之前，西甲球隊的情況也差不多是這樣。

干杜比亞說：「一年前我就差點來到華倫西亞，但最終選擇留在了國際米蘭。後來馬塞利諾來了，他跟我說球隊會保持穩定性，我認為這是我加盟的最佳時刻。」

「華倫西亞的球迷要求很高，但他們對球隊很有熱情。我在這裡非常開心，因為這裡擁有我想要的一切！我希望能留在這裡。」

干杜比亞希望能永久轉會華倫西亞，不過他2500萬歐元的買斷費是個障礙。

轉自新浪飛機文

擊敗曼聯曼城巴塞祖記巴黎 國米5年合同鎖鐵閘

　　《共和報》消息，由於迪維積未能與拉素續約，在賽季結束後他將成為一名自由球員。據悉，國米已經接近和迪維積達成協議。

　　當地時間昨天晚上，由於迪維積方面持續拖延與球隊續約，拉素方面已經撤回了續約提議。拉素體育總監在接受採訪時也承認，球員將在賽季結束後以自由身離隊。

　　多支球隊都希望簽下迪維積，包括意甲的祖記和拿玻里、英超的曼聯、曼城、利物浦以及巴塞和巴黎聖日耳門。然而，《共和報》表示，國際米蘭已經捷足先登。他們接近與球員達成一份新合同，新合同為期5年，年薪400萬歐元加獎金。

　　同時，《共和報》也表示，如果國米未能獲得下季的歐聯資格，事情將會有新的變化。

Skriniar: ‘At Inter for years’

Inter defender Milan Skriniar sees himself at the club ‘for many years’ despite links with Barcelona.

The Slovakian international has caught the eye with his performances for the Nerazzurri this season, despite only joining the San Siro club last summer.

“I see myself here at Inter for many years,” Skriniar said after scoring in his side’s 2-0 win over Benevento last night.

“I’ve never said I wanted to leave, just that anything can happen.”

There has been renewed speculation over Skriniar’s future after a recent interview given in Slovak.

“The translation was wrong, all it takes is to change two or three words and it changes the meaning.

“I just want to help the team, by scoring too if I can. Defensively we have often conceded with the opposition’s first shot, which doesn’t help confidence.

“But finally we have managed to avoid conceding.”

Despite the win it was a difficult evening for Inter, who were outplayed by their modest opponents for long periods and were jeered by their own fans.

“A team that hasn’t won for two months is not in a good place, that’s the problem.

“After the goal we played with more freedom. We started to play well and kept the ball, that was important.

“Then the second goal came and we won.”

Victory moves Inter back up to third place, with Skriniar unconcerned by rivals Roma and Lazio’s results as they continue to chase a Champions League place.

“I don’t know who I fear more, both have their opposition and we have to focus on ourselves.

“If we don’t win it doesn’t matter about them.”

Figo: 'Anything could happen in Milan'

Inter hero Luis Figo believes “anything could happen” in the Derby della Madonnina this weekend with Milan.

The city rivals face off at San Siro and although the Nerazzurri are currently higher up the table, the Rossoneri have momentum on their side.

“The derby is always an unknown quantity,” Figo told Sky Sport Italia. “Current form counts for very little, because anything could happen.

“I have wonderful memories of the derby. The atmosphere was always fantastic and our results were always positive.

“Inter remain in my heart and I’m glad to see they are back to winning ways after a difficult moment.”

Lisandro Lopez: 'I had other offers'

January signing Lisandro Lopez reveals he “had many other offers, but you can’t say no to Inter. I had no doubts.”

The defender joined in January on loan with option to buy from Benfica for a total €9.5m.

“From the first day, all the Inter fans showed me great affection and I immediately felt this club was like a family,” the Argentine told Inter TV.

“It’s a great thing, because with the unity and humility shown, we can achieve great objectives. Mauro Icardi, Matias Vecino and Borja Valero immediately helped me to settle in. I also knew Joao Cancelo from his time at Benfica and have a great rapport with Rafinha.

“We know full well what the objectives are for this club and we must all work for this. The fans can rest easy, I will defend the jersey.

“I had many other offers to leave Lisbon, but as soon as my agent mentioned Inter, I had no doubts. You can’t say no to Inter. I already knew about Serie A thanks to some friendlies against Italian sides. I’ve always watched it, just like La Liga and the Premier League. The game is very tactical here.

“Julio Cesar is a friend and he told me all about Inter and its history. He confessed that he was very happy here, but also had a lot of responsibility.”

Lisandro Lopez also revealed how he chose shirt number 2, once worn at Inter by legend Beppe Bergomi.

“I always liked 2 and it has been part of my career for a while now. I’ll try to honour the Inter jersey in the best way.”

我覺得佢算係靚簽，米蘭達老化傷患多、vanheu斷十字，咁抵價簽到個葡超兵做替補

“It’s a great thing, because with the unity and humility shown, we can achieve great objectives. Mauro Icardi, Matias Vecino and Borja Valero immediately helped me to settle in. I also knew Joao Cancelo from his time at Benfica and have a great rapport with Rafinha.

“We know full well what the objectives are for this club and we must all work for this. The fans can rest easy, I will defend the jersey.

“I had many other offers to leave Lisbon, but as soon as my agent mentioned Inter, I had no doubts. You can’t say no to Inter. I already knew about Serie A thanks to some friendlies against Italian sides. I’ve always watched it, just like La Liga and the Premier League. The game is very tactical here.

“Julio Cesar is a friend and he told me all about Inter and its history. He confessed that he was very happy here, but also had a lot of responsibility.”

Lisandro Lopez also revealed how he chose shirt number 2, once worn at Inter by legend Beppe Bergomi.

“I always liked 2 and it has been part of my career for a while now. I’ll try to honour the Inter jersey in the best way.”

意媒曝財危機　國米斥指控失實

意大利媒體《Il Sole 24 Ore》日前指國際米蘭陷入財政危機，依國際米蘭目前財政狀況未達標準應無法注冊意甲賽事並且降班，惟意大利足總及意甲。國際米蘭官方則表示其財政狀況並無任何問題。

該意媒續指國米因股東投資不足，淨資產錄得83.41M元歐負數，按年下跌29M歐元。

媒體續指，去年國米淨損失達24.6M歐元，比2016年的63.1M為低。

此外又提到去年國米總負債達到637.56M歐元，按年增加150M。

股東貸款錄得221M歐元，銀行負債則為208M歐元，球員交易的債項錄得112.5歐元。

國際米蘭昨日發表公開聲明，指出上述報導指控失實及具有誤導性。聲明中指國米現在財政狀況穩健，而且合符意大利法律及達到意大利足總之要求。

聲明又指，截至2017年6月30日的財政報告已於球會各架構與及股東大會上通過，然後交由職業球會監察委員會（Professional Football Clubs Supervisory Commission）檢查。

球會表示將會採取合適法律行動，以保障球會及其形象。

近日，江蘇蘇寧中場拉美利斯接受了巴西媒體《UOL》採訪。在談話中他表示渴望在退役前返回車路士踢球，但眼下仍專注於幫助蘇寧取得好成績。

拉美利斯說道：「對於這支隊伍，我一直有特殊的感情，在我退役前我仍渴望能在那裡踢球。如今我正努力恢復傷病，車仔就像我的第二個家，我亦知道車仔的大門總是為我敞開著。若有一天，能再次穿上那件球衣，那將是件無與倫比的事。」

「在中國的第一年很不錯，我很快就適應了。我們在三線中競爭，所以這是很出色的賽季。去年面對諸多變化，我們遭遇了很多困難。但對於2018年，我們做了很充分的準備，我在這很開心，我的家人也一樣。我渴望為達到目標繼續奮鬥。」

「有很多人在談論關於國際米蘭對我的興趣，但並沒有具體的東西直接聯繫到我，至少直到今天仍是這樣。大家都知道國際是一家偉大的球會，再次到歐洲踢球是我渴望的目標。不過眼下我仍專注於幫助蘇寧，在2018年取得好成績，目前我的腦海裡沒有其他的東西。」

原來我地真係咩都冇做過

Saponara’s tribute to Astori: “Get out of that damn room



“Oh captain, my captain. Why did you not come down to have breakfast with all of us? Why did you not pick up your shoes from outside of Marco (Sportiello)’s room and then drink your orange juice, as usual?

Now they’ll tell us that life goes on, that we must look forward and pick ourselves up, but what will your absence taste like? Who will arrive every morning in the cafeteria, warming up everyone with his smile?

Who will ask us about what we did the previous night and have a laugh about it? Who will nurture the youngsters and give a sense of responsibility to the veterans? Who will form the circle to work on our ‘two-touch play’ and who will demolish Marco on the PlayStation?

With whom will we debate about Masterchef, Florence’s restaurants, TV series or games played? Who will I lean on at lunch after a tiring training session? Come on, come back. You still need to finish watching LaLaLand to analyse like you did with all new movies.

Come back to Florence, they’re waiting for you to renew your contract and acknowledge all the good and the positivity that you bring to us on a daily basis. Get out of that damn room, we’ll be waiting for you tomorrow at training.

In life there are people you’ve known forever but have never bonded with, and then there are the ‘Davides’, who warm to you immediately with a simple ‘Welcome to Florence, Ricky’.

Wherever you are now, keep on defending our goal and enlighten the right path for us from the backline. Oh captain, my captain. Forever, my captain

But Atletico angered Racing by putting Martinez through medical examinations that had not been agreed to by his club, and negotiations subsequently stalled.

Ahead of tomorrow's league match, Luciano Spalletti spoke at the pre-match press conference discussing Inter vs. Napoli.

"Starting again after what has happened? They are events that remain with you. We are closer to one another, we are more in contact with one another and we hold each other in more affection than you could see from outside. The fundamental thing is that he was not just the captain of Fiorentina but of football in general. Astori leaves us with an important example of how integrity makes it a very thin line between being an opponent and being a team mate. When you met him, everyone said hello. It's something that leaves a mark."

"We will have to be nearly perfect because Sarri's team and his idea of football could provide ideas about the principles on which we should model our style of football. There are examples that already make up part of our style of play and one of those is Napoli."

"The desire to live up to the past history of this club is absolutely total. We are always slightly affected by other results because the table is very tight. For us, Inter vs. Napoli is a crucial match for our season. It is even more important because we have not managed to win in recent games. We need to win football matches, we cannot just try to manage them."

"Borja Valero has had some problems recently; we'll have to evaluate how many minutes he can play. Rafinha is constantly growing; he always trains better day by day and he always succeeds in developing his technical qualities and speed. We're happy. He himself sees that he's improving. He's managing to play his football for a longer period every time and this encourages us to hope that we'll soon have him totally available."

"In my opinion, Napoli are very strong. They have pace, possession, technique and goals. They have three players who can sense a goal. But I've also prepared well and we also have good stats."

Spalletti: 'I can't improve Inter'

Luciano Spalletti criticised his own Inter squad and suggested he can’t “improve this with work in training. I’ve been trying all season.”

The 0-0 draw with Napoli saw them create the best chance, when Milan Skriniar’s header turned a Joao Cancelo free kick on to the upright.

However, the Coach seemed well aware that Inter play very different football to the Partenopei. He noted it on Mediaset Premium and then continued the diatribe on Sky Sport Italia.

“I’ve worked with this team every day and I think there is simply a lack of quality. Napoli have quality, we don’t have much.

“We were solid, we allowed very little and were always a team, of course, but when we talk about quality, I say the difference between us and Napoli was visible.

“I repeat, I don’t think that I can improve this performance with work in training. I’ve been trying to do it all season.

“We have never played these great games where we pass the ball around quickly and with quality. Today we won back the ball five or six times and could’ve hurt them, but we didn’t.

“If we are satisfied with this performance, then it means we have already taken everything that we can. I am not satisfied, as we put in a decent game, but I would’ve preferred to win.”

This seemed to be a message sent directly to director Piero Ausilio and club owners Suning, especially when taking into account this comment Spalletti made to Rai Sport this evening.

“Borja Valero is good at recovering the ball. Rafinha played in his position and he’s doing well, but we mustn’t put too much responsibility on his shoulders.

“Don’t forget in January there were a dozen names circulating and in the end we only managed to sign him.”

Argentine striker Lautaro Martinez’s representative has confirmed the striker is ‘90% certain’ to join Inter despite interest from Atletico Madrid.

The Racing Club striker and Argentina Under-20 international had previously been strongly linked to both Atletico Madrid and Real Madrid.

In December there were widespread reports the 20-year-old had agreed to join Atletico in the summer of 2018, which had appeared to be confirmed by his agent.

“With Inter, it's 90% done,” Bety Yaque is quoted as saying by Marca.

“We had spoken with Manchester City before, while Fiorentina, Borussia Dortmund, Roma and Manchester United have also asked for him.

“As far as I can see, there is little possibility he will not sign for Inter as an agreement has been signed.

“Atletico Madrid were close but their offer was not as solid.”

Javier Zanetti: “I Hope To Stay At Inter Forever”

Dalbert: “I Chose Inter To Improve Defensively”

Inter defender Dalbert was the latest Nerazzurri star to feature on Inter TV show ‘Drive.’ The Brazilian spoke on a number of topics, firstly why he wears the number 29 on his shirt.

“The number 29 is a symbolic number for me. With this number I have had my worst moments but also the best. My family and I say it has always accompanied me.”

The full back then spoke on Inter and Serie A.

“I was surprised by the stadium and the fans, it’s something that gives me incredible emotions. It’s nice to see a lot of people motivating us and pushing the team in a positive way. I chose Inter because I wanted to improve defensively, as in Brazil we are very attack minded. I did not think Serie A would be so complicated on the tactical level. I was used to having more freedom on the attacking front, it was tough but I have learned a lot.”

http://sempreinter.com/2018/03/15/dalbert-i-chose-inter-to-improve-defensively/

Icardi: “I Hope I Can Win Titles For Inter”

Inter captain Mauro Icardi answered a series of questions from children for Italian children’s comic magazine Topolino.

Which Inter match do you remember most?

“The Champions League final of 2010 and the 3-2 Milan derby in October, when I scored a hat trick.”

How much responsibility is there to become the captain of Inter at only 22?

“At that age it is not normal but it is in my character to face the challenges put in front of me, receiving Javier Zanetti’s armband has given me so much as a player and as a man I proudly represent the team and the fans. I try to do my best.”

What will you give to Inter for the 110th birthday?

“I hope I can score many goals, win titles for the club and bring joy and satisfaction to the fans.”

How does it feel playing in front of 70,000 people?

“It’s extraordinary, there’s all those people shouting: ‘Come on Inter’ and your name! It’s great to be able to experience these emotions.”

How do you feel when you take a penalty?

“It’s a lot of responsibility, all the confidence of the team is in my feet, thousands of fans look at you holding their breath, but you have to put it in the net.”

Who is the best Inter player ever? And the best in the world?

Inter management have found a pre-contract agreement with Stefan de Vrij’s representatives FCInterNews.it understand.

The two parties have agreed to a five year contract which will see the Dutch defender earn €4.5 million net per season. Moreover, his representatives will receive a €4 million commission fee.

All that remains now is for Inter’s owners Suning to give their blessing to the agreement before De Vrij can put pen to paper and sign for the Nerazzurri. FCInterNews.it further report that all the documentation is currently being studied by the Chinese owners and a positive response is expected shortly.

Inter have pipped a whole host of clubs to the 26-year-old centre back’s signature, including a number of clubs from the Premier League as well as Spanish club Barcelona.

This season, de Vrij has played in no less than 35 games across all competitions for Simone Inzaghi’s side – 9 of which have ended with Lazio keeping a clean sheet.

Ahead of this weekend’s fixture with Sampdoria, Inter defender Milan Skriniar has previewed the game in an interview with Mediaset Premium.

“We have to give everything. It will be an extraordinary race, it’s always like this when you face your former team. We have to win. It’s been a long time since the last away win and our goal remains qualification for the Champions League. We have to always give 110% in every game and concentrate for every minute of it.”

Skriniar was then asked about Stefan de Vrij, who could be his partner in defence next season.

“He is a great player and he has so much quality, he could certainly help improve our team.”

The Slovakian defender proceeded by reviewing the 0-0 draw with Napoli last weekend, in which he put in a solid performance.

“Against them it’s never easy, they always had the ball but we had some good counter-attacks. The words of the coach are used to stimulate us, to give more and more and stay focused throughout the race.”

He concluded the interview by discussing his future at the Nerazzurri amid alleged interest from some of European football’s top clubs.

“I’m happy here at Inter.”

Inter, Spalletti: "The race for UCL spots goes by games like this one against Sampdoria. Perisic? I don't worry about him, he has divine qualities"

Inter's last away win goes back to the 25th of last November. It's time to make up for it for the Nerazzurri after the draw against Napoli and to still be in the race for Champions League. Next fixture is against Sampdoria at the Marassi stadium and Spalletti has presented the game in press conference:

"The Champions League position goes mainly from these games, because Samp is a strong and prepared team. We need victories, good performances and points to achieve our goal. Many away games? I expect personality. I think the team's strength and character gauge is the double challenge with Napoli, in the sense that they scored against everyone, they won against everyone. The fact that in some games, such as the ones against Napoli, we have reached a balance and suffered not much is symptomatic of our abilities. We need to be a very strong team. Within our qualities there is personality and character. Sometimes we can not express ourselves to the maximum and in those cases I say things that can stimulate the group to give the maximum. Perisic? My bending does not bother me. He has a divine quality, if he could give the maximum he would show all his class. But even looking at the other teams there are players who can not express themselves to the maximum with continuity. The midfield? In recent games there has been an accumulation of fatigue and physical problems. For this I have to evaluate everything and then choose accordingly".

From midfield to the attack, Spalletti tries to explain the reduced incisiveness in the goal: "The less goals sometimes depend on the period you are experiencing. When you're in a positive moment, you could even succeed in the most difficult things. When the wind pulls in the opposite direction, sometimes the actions do not end up as they should. From tomorrow I expect to see the continuity of the positive things I have seen in the last two games. Because something has changed. I have another two years contract to show that I deserve this prestigious bench. I have the opportunity to work with two talented professionals like Sabatini and Ausilio. What will make the difference for the Champions League fight? Competitors will make all our lives very difficult. We will have to make 11 games of the highest level. To reach the goal we can not play a good game and play two below our maximum level. The other teams that have to play other competitions also have some extra players, in addition to exhaustion. From now on we will have to be almost perfect as we have been in the double challenge with Napoli, or as against Juventus and Roma. Dalbert? He's growing up, he's training well. He had the disadvantage of getting to the championship started, not having the chance to get to know the context right from the start".
